Policy on Preservation of Documents

Effective Date: July 07, 2021

1. Background

Pursuant to Regulation 9 of Securities and Exchange Board of India (―SEBI‖) (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, as amended (―Listing Regulations‖), every listed company shall formulate a policy on preservation of documents (―Policy‖) which has to be approved by the board of directors.

2. Definitions

  • 2.1 "Act" means the Companies Act, 2013, Rules framed thereunder and any amendments thereto.
  • 2.2 "Applicable Law" means any law, rules, circulars, guidelines or standards under which the preservation of the Documents has been prescribed.
  • 2.3 "Authorised Person" means any person duly authorised by Managing Director.
  • 2.4 "Board" means the Board of directors of the Company or any of its Committee.
    • {/* Add more definitions */}

3. Coverage

This Policy is intended to guide the Company and its officer on maintenance of any Documents, their preservation and disposal.

4. Classification

The preservation of Documents shall be done in the following manner:

  • Where there is a period for which a Document is required to be preserved as per Applicable Law, for the period prescribed by Applicable Law.
  • Where there is no such requirement as per Applicable Law, then for such period as the document pertains to a matter which is covered under the definition of current documents.

5. Modes of Preservation

The Documents may be preserved in:

  • Physical form
  • Electronic Form

6. Custody of Documents

The custody of the Documents shall be with the Authorised Person, as defined earlier. Further processes for handing over of documents are explained in detail.

7. Destruction of Documents

The Documents will be destroyed after the relevant or prescribed period by the Authorised Person.
